Test Case 1: Execute the Advanced Intercompany Sales Flow

Objective: To create a customer sales order in the selling company that is delivered by an affiliated company, and to process all subsequent logistical and financial documents correctly.

Step 1: Create Sales Order (Selling Company)

Objective: The process starts when the selling company creates a sales order for the external customer, but specifies that the goods will be delivered from an affiliate's plant.

  • Role: Internal Sales Representative
  • App: Manage Sales Orders (F1873)

Execution Steps:

  1. Log on to the Fiori launchpad as user
    S4H_SD_DEM.
  2. Navigate to the
    Sales section and open the Manage Sales Orders app.
  3. Click
    Create Sales Order.
  4. Enter the following organizational data and press Enter :
    • Order Type: OR
    • Sales Organization: 1010
    • Distribution Channel: 10
    • Division: 00
  5. On the
    Create Standard Order: Overview screen, enter the following header and item data :
    • Sold-to Party: 10100002
    • Cust. Reference: PO-INTERCOMPANY-TEST
    • Deliver. Plant: 1710 (This is the critical step: specifying the US affiliate plant).
    • Material: TG12
    • Order Quantity: 10
  6. Go to the item details by selecting the item and navigating to the
    Shipping tab.
  7. Fill in the following field:
    • Transit Plant: 1010. This plant represents the selling company's ownership of the stock while it is in transit.
  8. Click
    Save.

Expected Result: A standard sales order is created in the selling company (1010). Note down the Sales Order Number. The system automatically triggers the creation of an intercompany purchase order in company 1010 and an intercompany sales order in company 1710 in the background.

Step 2: Display Intercompany Purchase Order

Objective: To confirm that the system automatically created an intercompany purchase order in the selling company to procure the goods from the delivering company.

  • Role: Internal Sales Representative
  • App: Monitor Value Chains (F4854)

Execution Steps:

  1. From the Fiori launchpad, open the
    Monitor Value Chains app.
  2. In the filter bar, enter the following:
    • Initiating Document: Your Sales Order number from Step 1.
    • Process Type: Advanced Intercompany Sales
  3. Click Go.
  4. Click on the line item that appears in the
    Business Processes list.
  5. In the
    Documents list, locate the step "IC Purchase Order (POIC)".
  6. Click on the document number link to display the intercompany purchase order.

Expected Result: The system displays the intercompany purchase order created in the selling company (1010) with the delivering plant (1710) as the vendor. Note down the

Purchase Order Number.

Step 3: Display Intercompany Sales Order

Objective: To confirm the creation of the corresponding intercompany sales order in the delivering company.

  • Role: Internal Sales Representative
  • App: Monitor Value Chains (F4854)

Execution Steps:

  1. Return to the Monitor Value Chains screen for your sales order.
  2. In the
    Documents list, locate the step "IC Sales Order (SOIC)".
  3. Click on the document number link to display the intercompany sales order .

Expected Result: The system displays the intercompany sales order created in the delivering company (1710). The sold-to party will be the intercompany customer representing the selling company (e.g.,

10411010). Note down the

Intercompany Sales Order Number.

Step 4: Create Delivery (Delivering Company)

Objective: The delivering company now creates an outbound delivery to ship the goods directly to the end customer.

  • Role: Shipping Specialist
  • App: Create Outbound Deliveries - From Sales Orders (F0869A)

Execution Steps:

  1. Open the
    Create Outbound Deliveries - From Sales Orders app.
  2. Enter the following selection criteria and click
    Go :
    • Shipping Point: 1710
    • Order: Your original sales order number from Step 1.
  3. Select the sales order item from the list and click
    Create Deliveries .

Expected Result: An outbound delivery document is created successfully. Note down the

Delivery Number.

Step 5: Perform Picking

Objective: To pick the goods from the storage location in preparation for shipping.

  • Role: Shipping Specialist
  • App: Manage Outbound Deliveries (F0867A) or My Outbound Delivery Monitor (VL06O)

Execution Steps:

  1. Open the
    My Outbound Delivery Monitor (VL06O) app.
  2. Click on
    For Picking.
  3. Enter your Shipping Point (
    1710) and press Execute.
  4. Select your delivery document and choose
    Change Outbound Deliveries.
  5. Navigate to the
    Picking tab.
  6. Enter the delivery quantity (e.g.,
    10) in the Picked Qty field.
  7. Click
    Save.

Expected Result: The picking status of the delivery is updated to "Fully Picked". The delivery document is saved.

Step 6: Post Goods Issue (PGI)

Objective: To post the goods issue, which signifies that the goods have left the delivering plant. This transaction transfers the material into Valuated Stock in Transit.

  • Role: Shipping Specialist
  • App: My Outbound Delivery Monitor (VL06O)

Execution Steps:

  1. Open the
    My Outbound Delivery Monitor (VL06O) app.
  2. Click on
    For Goods Issue.
  3. Enter your Shipping Point (
    1710) and press Execute.
  4. Select your delivery document and click the
    Post Goods Issue button.
  5. Confirm the posting date in the dialog box and click
    Continue.

Expected Result: The goods issue is posted successfully. The inventory in plant 1710 is reduced. The ownership of the goods is transferred to the selling company (1010) and is now reflected as

Stock in Transit. The follow-on goods movements are scheduled based on the Transfer of Control dates.

Step 7: Confirm Transfer of Control (ToC) Dates

Objective: To confirm the dates when the control of goods transfers between affiliates (internal) and from the selling company to the customer (external). This is a critical step that triggers further financial postings.

  • Role: Shipping Specialist
  • App: Outbound Delivery Monitor or directly change the outbound delivery.

Execution Steps:

  1. Find and open your outbound delivery in change mode.
  2. From the top menu, navigate via:
    More > Goto > Header > Shipment.
  3. In the
    Internal Transfer of Control Dates section, update the Actual Date and Time to the current system date and time. This controls the posting from the delivering company's SIT to the selling company's SIT.
  4. In the
    External Transfer of Control Dates section, update the Actual Date and Time to the current system date and time. This controls the final goods issue from the selling company's SIT to the customer (representing the COGS posting).
  5. Click Save.

Expected Result: The Transfer of Control dates are confirmed. The system executes the following goods movements and financial postings in the background :

  • Post Goods Issue from SiT in delivering company: COGS is posted for the delivering company.
  • Post Goods Receipt to selling company: Inventory is received into the selling company's books.
  • Post Stock Transfer to SiT in selling company: Inventory is moved to the selling company's SIT.
  • Post Goods Issue from SiT to Customer: COGS is posted for the selling company.

Step 8: Create Intercompany Invoice

Objective: The delivering company (1710) bills the selling company (1010) for the goods provided.

  • Role: Billing Clerk
  • App: Create Billing Documents (F0798)

Execution Steps:

  1. Open the
    Create Billing Documents app.
  2. In the search area, enter your
    Delivery Number and press Enter.
  3. Select the row for your delivery and click the
    Create Billing Documents button.
  4. A dialog box appears. Choose the following and click
    OK:
    • Billing Type: IV2 (Intercompany Invoice)
    • Billing Date: Current date
  5. The system will display a draft billing document. Review it and click
    Save.

Expected Result: An intercompany invoice (type IV2) is created and posted in company 1710. The system automatically triggers the creation of the corresponding intercompany supplier invoice in company 1010. Note down the

Intercompany Invoice Number.

Step 9: Display Intercompany Supplier Invoice

Objective: To confirm that the supplier invoice was automatically received and created in the selling company's system.

  • Role: Accounts Payable Accountant
  • App: Monitor Value Chains (F4854) or Supplier Invoices List (F1060a)

Execution Steps:

  1. Navigate back to the Monitor Value Chains app and refresh the view for your sales order.
  2. Locate the document for the step
    "IC Supplier Invoice (SIIC)" and click the link to display it.
  3. Alternatively, open the
    Supplier Invoices List app and search for the document using the intercompany invoice number in the Reference field.

Expected Result: The intercompany supplier invoice is displayed in the selling company's system. The vendor will be the intercompany supplier representing the delivering company (e.g.,

17401710).

Step 10: Create Customer Invoice

Objective: The final step is for the selling company (1010) to create the invoice for the end customer.

  • Role: Billing Clerk
  • App: Create Billing Documents (F0798)

Execution Steps:

  1. Open the
    Create Billing Documents app.
  2. Enter your
    Delivery Number in the search area and press Enter.
  3. Select the row for your delivery and click the
    Create Billing Documents button.
  4. In the dialog box, choose the following and click
    OK:
    • Billing Type: F2 (Invoice)
    • Billing Date: Current date
  5. Review the draft invoice and click
    Save.

Expected Result: The final customer invoice (type F2) is created and posted. The accounts receivable and revenue accounts are updated in the selling company's books. Note down the Customer Invoice Number.

Step 11: Monitor the Completed Value Chain

Objective: To review the entire end-to-end process flow and see the status of all linked documents in one place.

  • Role: Internal Sales Representative
  • App: Monitor Value Chains (F4854)

Execution Steps:

  1. Open the
    Monitor Value Chains app.
  2. Search for your initiating
    Sales Order Number.
  3. The system will display the value chain. All steps should now show a
    Completed status.
  4. Click on the
    Process Flow tab to see a graphical representation of the document flow. Each node in the flow chart represents a step and contains details like the document number and status .

Expected Result: The value chain monitor displays a complete, end-to-end flow chart of the process, with all documents linked and showing a completed (green) status. This provides a perfect audit trail of the entire transaction.

6. Summary

This guide has walked you through the Advanced Intercompany Sales process in SAP S/4HANA, from the initial customer order to the final invoicing and monitoring. By leveraging this functionality, organizations can manage complex internal supply chains with greater efficiency, transparency, and financial control. Following the business case and test plan provides a solid, practical understanding of how to execute and manage these transactions in a modern SAP environment.
